etymologies: late Middle English (in sequence (sense 4 of the noun)): from late Latin sequentia, from Latin sequent- ‘following’, from the verb sequi ‘follow’

definitions: a particular order in which related events, movements, or things follow each other

examples.text: the content of the program should follow a logical sequence

shortDefinitions: particular order in which related things follow each other

definitions: a repetition of a phrase or melody at a higher or lower pitch

examples.text: a restless search for interesting harmonic sequences

shortDefinitions: repetition of phrase or melody at higher or lower pitch

definitions: the order in which amino acid or nucleotide residues are arranged in a protein, DNA, etc.

examples.text: these are enzymes which will cleave only at specific base sequences in the DNA

shortDefinitions: order in which amino-acid or nucleotide residues are arranged in protein

definitions: a set of related events, movements, or things that follow each other in a particular order
shortDefinitions: set of related events, movements, or items

definitions: a set of three or more playing cards of the same suit next to each other in value, for example 10, 9, 8.
shortDefinitions: set of three or more playing cards of same suit next to each other in value

definitions: an infinite ordered series of numerical quantities.
shortDefinitions: infinite ordered series of numerical quantities

definitions: a part of a film dealing with one particular event or topic
shortDefinitions: part of film dealing with one particular event or topic

definitions: (in the Eucharist) a hymn said or sung after the Gradual or Alleluia that precedes the Gospel.
shortDefinitions: (in Eucharist) hymn said or sung after Gradual or Alleluia that precedes Gospel

examples.text: trainee librarians decide how a set of misfiled cards could be sequenced

definitions: ascertain the sequence of amino acid or nucleotide residues in (a protein, DNA, etc.)

examples.text: we have undertaken to isolate and sequence the rat retinoblastoma cDNA
independent clones were analyzed by DNA sequencing

shortDefinitions: ascertain sequence of amino-acid or nucleotide residues in

definitions: play or record (music) with a sequencer.
shortDefinitions: play or record music with sequencer
